Source: Goethe-Institut India (goethe.de/ins/in): B2 Super-Intensive course INR26000-30000 per level typical; full A1-B2 cumulative ~INR80000-150000 at Goethe; private institutes (German Haus Delhi KGIC Pune etc.) INR50000-300000 range depending on intensity and duration; Landesaerztekammer (various state chambers e.g. aerztekammer-berlin.de aerztekammer-nordrhein.de): Fachsprachpruefung EUR350-500 varies by Bundesland; Kenntnisspruefung EUR300-500; Approbation application EUR200-600 (Regierungspraesidium or Landesamt); ZAB (kmk.org/zab): Zeugnisbewertung ~EUR200 plus processing; anabin database (anabin.kmk.org): degree equivalence check free but ZAB formal evaluation required for most Indian MBBS degrees; German Embassy India (india.diplo.de): Job Seeker Visa EUR75 national visa fee; Work/Residence Permit (aufenthaltstitel) EUR100 + Blue Card EUR100; Auswaertiges-amt.de: visa regulations; Flights (Skyscanner Google Flights Feb 2026 Delhi/Mumbai to Frankfurt/Munich economy): INR35000-80000; WG-Gesucht.de ImmobilienScout24.de: shared flat (WG) room EUR350-600/month; studio apartment EUR500-900/month; Kaution=2-3 months cold rent; TK AOK Barmer (tk.de aok.de): GKV statutory health insurance ~14.6%+supplementary for employed ~EUR160-250/month total employee share; incoming/expat insurance (Mawista DR-Walter): EUR80-150/month; Indian PCC (passportindia.gov.in): INR500 official fee; Panel physician medical exam India: INR5000-15000

Notes: COMPONENT COLUMN VALUES = typical/single-attempt scenario at EUR/INR 107.32 (Feb 2026 mid-market rate from ExchangeRate-API). --- APPROBATION ROUTE OVERVIEW: The Approbation route is the ONLY pathway for Indian medical graduates (IMGs) to practice medicine independently in Germany. Steps: (1) Learn German to B2 level minimum (6-12 months intensive in India), (2) Pass Fachsprachpruefung (medical German C1-level exam at Landesaerztekammer), (3) Obtain Berufserlaubnis (temporary restricted license to work under supervision while preparing for Kenntnisspruefung), (4) Pass Kenntnisspruefung (knowledge/equivalence exam) â€” required for Indian MBBS as degrees from India are generally NOT deemed fully equivalent under anabin, (5) Receive Approbation (full unrestricted medical license), (6) Career progression: Assistenzarzt (resident) to Facharzt (specialist after 5-6 years) to Oberarzt (senior physician). --- MIN SCENARIO (INR 471000): Budget German course at private institute A1-B2 (80000) + 1x Fachsprachpruefung EUR350 (37562) + 1x Kenntnisspruefung EUR300 EUR500 each = EUR1000 (107320) + 2x Kenntnisspruefung EUR500 each = EUR1000 (107320) + Approbation expensive Bundesland EUR600 (64392) + Comprehensive translation + notarization + apostille (40000) + + EUR2100 Kaution = EUR3500 (375620) + Private health insurance premium 3 months EUR300/month = EUR900 (96588) + PCC with expedited processing (5000) + Comprehensive medical exam (15000). --- KEY NOTES AND CAVEATS: (1) GERMAN B2 IS MANDATORY AND THE SINGLE BIGGEST VARIABLE COST. (2) FACHSPRACHPRUEFUNG PASS RATES: 50-70% depending on Bundesland. (3) BERUFSERLAUBNIS AS INTERIM OPTION: Doctors can START EARNING (EUR4500-5500/month gross as Assistenzarzt) while preparing for Kenntnisspruefung. (4) STATE-BY-STATE FEE VARIATION across 16 Bundeslaender. (5) TIMELINE: 1.5-3 years from start of German learning to full Approbation. (6) ACCOMMODATION COSTS VARY DRAMATICALLY BY CITY. (7) COMPARED TO UK/AU/CA: Germany migration is cheaper overall but requires MORE TIME due to language learning. (8) HEALTH INSURANCE IS MANDATORY from day one. (9) ALL COSTS ARE PRE-EMPLOYMENT.
